attributes.action: Investigate toxic waste fires burning on the Launders  Lane landfill site
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to open an inquiry in the hope that this environmental poisoning of the air the residents of Rainham are being forced to breath can stop. There are many complaints of local people experiencing breathing problems.
attributes.background: To find out what is buried in the ground and why it keeps igniting. Who is responsible for waste that has put there. Who owned and sold the site. who gave permission to keep using site for waste dumping. Did the local council or governing bodies know off any previous illegal dumping on the site.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Management of former landfill sites are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
